case_vignette: An 8-year-old male presents with 1 week of itchy blisters on the ears. He just recently returned from spring break with his family. He denies using any particular products on the ears before the rash. He says that this has occurred yearly for the last several years, always around the same time. He denies proximal muscle weakness. He denies flaking in the scalp.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have itchy blisters on my ears that have been there for a week.
Have these blisters spread to any other parts of your body?
No, the blisters are only on my ears.
Have you started using any new personal care products recently, such as shampoo, soap, or earrings?
No, I haven't used any particular new products on my ears before the rash started.
Do you have any allergies or a history of skin conditions?
I haven't mentioned any allergies or a history of skin conditions.
Have you been exposed to any extreme temperatures or environmental conditions recently?
I just returned from spring break with my family.
Did you spend extended periods in the sun during your spring break?
I haven't specifically mentioned sun exposure during my spring break.
Do the blisters contain clear or cloudy fluid, and have any of them burst?
I haven't mentioned the appearance of the fluid in the blisters or whether any have burst.
Can you describe the color and content of the fluid in the blisters?
I haven't described the color or content of the fluid in the blisters.
Do the blisters hurt or are they just itchy?
The blisters are itchy.
Final Diagnosis: Contact dermatitis.
